modules.description: This module defines the structure and accessors for working with Unix domain socket addresses. It provides fields to set or retrieve the address family and the path associated with a Unix socket. Use this module when binding or connecting to Unix domain sockets using low-level system interfaces.

This module defines constants and types essential for working with Unix domain sockets, including the address family `af_unix` and the maximum socket path length `sun_path_len`. It provides a structured representation of the `sockaddr_un` type through the `SockaddrUnix` module, which exposes fields to manipulate the address family and socket path. These components enable tasks like binding and connecting to Unix sockets, supporting low-level inter-process communication. Example uses include setting up Unix socket servers or clients by configuring socket addresses and interacting with system calls like `bind` or `connect`.

This module provides core definitions and structures for working with Unix domain sockets, including the `af_unix` address family and `sun_path_len` constant. It centers around the `SockaddrUnix` type, which represents Unix socket addresses with fields for the address family and socket path. These components enable configuration of socket endpoints for operations like binding, connecting, or listening on Unix sockets. Example uses include constructing socket addresses for local inter-process communication or setting up Unix socket servers and clients.

This module defines constants related to Unix domain sockets, including the address family `af_unix` and the maximum length of the socket path `sun_path_len`. It works with integer constants and is used for configuring and handling Unix socket addresses. Concrete use cases include setting up Unix domain sockets for inter-process communication and validating socket path lengths.

This module provides constants for working with Unix domain sockets, such as the address family `af_unix` and the maximum path length `sun_path_len`. It enables configuration and validation of Unix socket addresses, ensuring compatibility with system limits. Use it to set up inter-process communication channels or enforce path constraints when creating socket endpoints.

This module provides operations to construct, access, and convert Unix domain socket addresses. It works with C-compatible `sockaddr_un` structures, exposing fields like `sun_family` and `sun_path` for direct manipulation. Concrete use cases include binding or connecting to Unix domain sockets using paths and converting from generic `sockaddr_storage` pointers.

This module combines low-level Unix domain socket constants and address manipulation with utilities for working with `sockaddr_un` structures. It enables converting between Unix-specific and generic socket addresses, supporting operations like binding or connecting to sockets using file system paths. Direct use cases include constructing socket addresses with `sun_path` and handling C-compatible structures in system calls. The module integrates address creation, accessors, and conversions to facilitate socket communication in Unix environments.
